subject: Education
title: The Printing Press: Education's First Disruption
description: Learn The Printing Press: Education's First Disruption in one minute.

hook.text: Before Gutenberg, a single book cost as much as a house. Afterward, ideas spread like wildfire.

buildup.text: Medieval education depended on hand-copied texts, limiting knowledge to monasteries and courts.

discovery.text: The printing press made books affordable, enabling self-education and mass literacy for the first time.

twist.text: Church leaders feared the press would spread heresyâ€”and they were partly right.

climax.text: Within decades, printed pamphlets fueled the Reformation and changed education permanently.

punchline.text: Every revolution in education starts with a revolution in access to information.

quiz.question: How did the printing press change education?
